verses.quote: Ali ibn Abi Talib said, 'Hearts are like wild beasts. They attach themselves to those who love and train them.'
verses.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

verses.quote: Ibn Abbas said, 'A good deed brings light to the heart, illumination to the face, strength to the body, and love in the hearts of people.'
verses.author: Abdullah ibn Abbas

verses.quote: Imam Shafi'i said, 'To be able to thank Allah for a blessing is a blessing within itself.'
verses.author: Imam Shafi'i

verses.quote: Abu Bakr as-Siddiq said, 'The more knowledge you have, the greater will be your fear of Allah.'
verses.author: Ab

verses.quote: Imam Malik said, 'Knowledge does not consist in narrating much. Knowledge is but a light which Allah places in the heart.'
verses.author: Imam Malik

verses.quote: Umar ibn Al-Khattab said, 'No amount of guilt can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.'
verses.author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab
verses.reference: Al-Bidayah wa Nihayah by Ibn Kathir

verses.quote: Hasan al-Basri said, 'O son of Adam, you are nothing but a number of days, whenever each day passes then a part of you has gone.'
verses.author: Hasan al-Basri

verses.quote: Ibn Qayyim said, 'Patience is that the heart does not feel anger towards what is destined and that the mouth does not complain.'
verses.author: Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya

verses.quote: Ibn Taymiyyah said, 'What can my enemies do to me? My paradise is in my heart. If they imprison me, it is solitude with Allah.'
verses.author: Ibn Taymiyyah

verses.quote: Abdullah ibn Mubarak said, 'How many people are trapped in ill health and grief, while the blessing of Allah passes them by.'
verses.author: Ab

verses.quote: Ali ibn Abi Talib said, 'The strongest among you is he who subdues his own anger.'
verses.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

verses.quote: Hasan al-Basri said, 'Do not let your anger be upon those who obey Allah, for the armies of Allah are victorious.'
verses.author: Hasan al-Basri

verses.quote: Ibn Mubarak said, 'The beginning of knowledge is intention, then listening, then understanding, then action, then preservation, and then spreading it.'
verses.author: Abdullah ibn Mubarak

verses.quote: Imam Shafi'i said, 'Anger begins with madness and ends with regret.'
verses.author: Imam Shafi'i

verses.quote: Umar ibn Abdul Aziz said, 'The one of a man is his intellect, and his honor is his religion, while his manhood is his good character.'
verses.author: Umar ibn Abdul Aziz

verses.quote: Ibn Mas'ud said, 'The true believer sees his sins as if he were sitting under a mountain which he fears may fall on him.'
verses.author: Abdullah ibn Mas'ud

verses.quote: Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal said, 'If you fear to be alone, know that Allah is with you.'
verses.author: Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal
verses.reference: Manaqib al-Imam Ahmad by Ibn al-Jawzi

verses.quote: Ibn Qayyim said, 'He who has found Allah, what has he lost? And he who has lost Allah, what has he found?'
verses.author: Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya

verses.quote: Fudayl ibn 'Iyad said, 'The fear of Allah is the fruit of knowledge and the key to the doors of wisdom.'
verses.author: Fudayl ibn 'Iyad

verses.quote: Imam Malik said, 'Knowledge does not consist in narrating much. Knowledge is but a light which Allah places in the heart.'
verses.author: Imam Malik

verses.quote: Uthman ibn Affan said, 'Worrying about comes from sins; happiness comes from repentance.'
verses.author: Uthman ibn Affan
verses.reference: Al-Bidayah wa Nihayah by Ibn Kathir

verses.quote: Ibn Taymiyyah said, 'A calamity that makes you turn to Allah is better for you than a blessing which makes you forget the remembrance of Allah.'
verses.author: Ibn Taymiyyah

verses.quote: Hasan al-Basri said, 'Do not resent calamities that come and the problems that occur, for perhaps in something that you dislike will be your salvation, and perhaps in something that you prefer will be your doom.'
verses.author: Hasan al-Basri

verses.quote: Ibn Qayyim said, 'The heart will rest and feel relief if it is settled with Allah, and it will worry and be anxious if it is settled with people.'
verses.author: Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya

verses.quote: Abu Bakr as-Siddiq said, 'Have an sincere intention in all of your actions, and you will attain your hopes.'
verses.author: Abu Bakr as-Siddiq

verses.quote: Imam Shafi'i said, 'Knowledge is that which benefits, not that which is memorized.'
verses.author: Imam Shafi'i

verses.quote: Ibn Mas'ud said, 'Learn, and when you have learned, act.'
verses.author: Abdullah ibn Mas'ud

verses.quote: Ibn Taymiyyah said, 'The more the servant loves his Master, the less will he care for the opinions of the creation.'
verses.author: Ibn Taymiyyah

verses.quote: Fudayl ibn 'Iyad said, 'Whoever pursues leadership will not succeed, and whoever is content with what Allah has decreed for him will have peace.'
verses.author: Fudayl ibn 'Iyad

verses.quote: Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal said, 'People need knowledge more than they need food and drink, because they need knowledge every time they take a breath.'
verses.author: Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal
verses.reference: Manaqib al-Imam Ahmad by Ibn al-Jawzi

verses.quote: Ibn Qayyim said, 'Patience is of two types: patience for avoiding what is prohibited, and patience in accepting destiny.'
verses.author: Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya

verses.quote: Umar ibn Al-Khattab said, 'No affliction befalls a servant but that Allah expiates some of his sins because of it.'
verses.author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab

verses.quote: Imam Shafi'i said, 'Let not your tongue mention the shame of another, for you yourself are covered in shame and all men have tongues.'
verses.author: Imam Shafi'i

verses.quote: Hasan al-Basri said, 'Whoever is content, will have enough; whoever is not, will not have enough.'
verses.author: Hasan al-Basri

verses.quote: Abu Bakr as-Siddiq said, 'The more humble, the higher you will be raised; the more you forgive, the more you will be honored.'
verses.author: Abu Bakr as-Siddiq
verses.reference: Al-Bidayah wa Nihayah by Ibn Kathir

verses.quote: Ali ibn Abi Talib said, 'The sin that makes you sad and repentant is more liked by Allah than the good deed which turns you arrogant.'
verses.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

verses.quote: Ibn Qayyim said, 'Regret is the beginning of repentance, and it is the foundation of the awakening of the heart.'
verses.author: Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya

verses.quote: Hasan al-Basri said, 'A man may commit a sin and never forget it, but because of it he enters Paradise.'
verses.author: Hasan al-Basri

verses.quote: Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal said, 'Our sins are many, but His mercy is limitless.'
verses.author: Imam Ahmad ibn Hanbal
verses.reference: Manaqib al-Imam Ahmad by Ibn al-Jawzi

verses.quote: Fudayl ibn 'Iyad said, 'If you cannot compete with the righteous in good deeds, compete with the sinners in seeking Allah's forgiveness.'
verses.author: Fudayl ibn 'Iyad

verses.quote: Umar ibn Al-Khattab said, 'I dislike to see a man doing nothing for this world or the Hereafter.'
verses.author: Umar ibn Al-Khattab
verses.reference: Al-Bidayah wa Nihayah by Ibn Kathir

verses.quote: Imam Shafi'i said, 'Time is like a sword: if you don't cut it, it will cut you.'
verses.author: Imam Shafi'i

verses.quote: Ibn Mas'ud said, 'I detest a man whom I see idle, neither working for this world nor for the Hereafter.'
verses.author: Abdullah ibn Mas'ud

verses.quote: Hasan al-Basri said, 'O son of Adam, you are nothing but days, whenever a day passes, a part of you has gone.'
verses.author: Hasan al-Basri

verses.quote: Ibn Qayyim said, 'Wasting time is worse than death because death separates you from this world whereas wasting time separates you from Allah.'
verses.author: Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyya
